intro: Monospora rotundifolia, commonly known as the round-leaf monospora, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes familiar plants such as carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its rounded, heart-shaped leaves and small, clustered white or yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
